bitfield.description: Reserved for HW R&D
Reserved for HW R&D
Reserved for HW R&D
Reserved for HW R&D
This register is used to pass data to the system security logic. The data is transmit from the external JTAG interface and hence is the Rx path for the SECAP interface.
This register is provides the handshake for the JTAGTXDATA Register and can also be used to pass control information to the system security logic.
Tx Interrupt to indicate avaliablity of TXDATA . 1 - TXDATA available ; 0 - TXDATA not available
This register is used to pass data from the system security logic. The data is transmit from the SECAP interface to external JTAG interface and hence is the Tx path for the SECAP interface.
This register is provides the handshake for the JTAGRXDATA Register and can also be used to pass control information from the system security logic
Tx Interrupt to indicate avaliablity of RXDATA . 1 - RXDATA available ; 0 - RXDATA not available

Write pulse bit field: Start Memory intialization of Param memory.Write 0x1 to start memory initilization.Write 0x0 after ensuring Memory intilization is in progress or has completed.Before starting new initilzation sequence ensure that there is no initilization sequence is in progress (ie MEMINIT_STATUS should be 0x0) and clear any previouls complettion status(ie write 0x1 to clear MEMINIT_DONE)
Status field. Read value 0x1 indicates previously triggered Memory intialization of Param memory is in progress.

Status field. Read value 0x1 indicates previously triggered Memory intialization of Param memory is complte. Write 0x1 to clear status. Refer Memory initialization sequnce in EDMA section for more details
Write pulse bit field: This register should be written once finishing writing into the mailbox memory of processor 7
Write pulse bit field: This register should be written once finishing writing into the mailbox memory of processor 6
Write pulse bit field: This register should be written once finishing writing into the mailbox memory of processor 5
Write pulse bit field: This register should be written once finishing writing into the mailbox memory of processor 4

Write pulse bit field: This register should be written once finishing writing into the mailbox memory of processor 2
Write pulse bit field: This register should be written once finishing writing into the mailbox memory of processor 1
Write pulse bit field: This register should be written once finishing writing into the mailbox memory of processor 0
This is request from processor 7 to HSM. Requesting it to read from mailbox.
This is request from processor 6 to HSM. Requesting it to read from mailbox.
This is request from processor 5 to HSM. Requesting it to read from mailbox.
This is request from processor 4 to HSM. Requesting it to read from mailbox.
This is request from processor 3 to HSM. Requesting it to read from mailbox.
This is request from processor 2 to HSM. Requesting it to read from mailbox.
This is request from processor 1 to HSM. Requesting it to read from mailbox.
This is request from processor 0 to HSM. Requesting it to read from mailbox.
This register should be written once finishing reading from hsm's mailbox written by proc 7
This register should be written once finishing reading from hsm's mailbox written by proc 6
This register should be written once finishing reading from hsm's mailbox written by proc 5
This register should be written once finishing reading from hsm's mailbox written by proc 4
This register should be written once finishing reading from hsm's mailbox written by proc 3
This register should be written once finishing reading from hsm's mailbox written by proc 2
This register should be written once finishing reading from hsm's mailbox written by proc 1
This register should be written once finishing reading from hsm's mailbox written by proc 0
Used to select one of the 64 interrupts which would go as second trigger to WDT
Used to select one of the 64 interrupts which would go as first trigger to WDT
Used to select one of the 64 interrupts which would go as second trigger to RTI
Used to select one of the 64 interrupts which would go as first trigger to RTI
Software configration for DMA Request
Write pulse bit field: Software configration for INT Request
Software configration for ESM Request

Indicates the Reset Cause of MSS Has the status because of which reset has happened. Bit0: por_reset Bit1: warm reset Bit2: stc reset Bit3: mmr_reset for resetting CPU0 and vim0 Bit4: mmr_reset for resetting CPU1 and VIM1 Bit5: mmr_reset for resettng CPU0 only Bit6: mmr_reset for resetting CPU1 only Bit7: reset caused becasue for dbg_rst_req by CPU0 Bit8: reset caused becasue for dbg_rst_req by CPU0 Bit9: reset caused by the reset_fsm
Write pulse bit field: Writing '111' will clear the HSM_MSS_RST_CAUSE_STATUS field

No privID replacement. A value of 1 will pass through privid value. A value of 0 will replace privid with priv_id field value
Make outgoing non-secure. A value of 1 forces secure clear, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.
Make outgoing secure. A value of 3'b111 forces secure set, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.
Privilidge ID configuration
No privID replacement. A value of 1 will pass through privid value. A value of 0 will replace privid with priv_id field value
Make outgoing non-secure. A value of 1 forces secure clear, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.
Make outgoing secure. A value of 3'b111 forces secure set, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.

Make outgoing non-secure. A value of 1 forces secure clear, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.
Make outgoing secure. A value of 3'b111 forces secure set, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.
Privilidge ID configuration
HSM PBIST controller will be reset when value is 0xA
HSM PBIST Selftest Key. Valid value is 0x5

Debug Masters (DBG_JTAG, DBG_RS232, DMM) Privid Override. A value of '1b1 will override the hardware tie-off privid and provide control to respective ISC register, in case of EMU device and HS-FS, SOP1,2,3.
